verses.verse: And Saul<WH7586> spake<WH1696> to Jonathan<WH3129> his son<WH1121>, and to all his servants<WH5650>, that they should slay<WH4191> David<WH1732>. But Jonathan, Saul's son, delighted much in David.

And Jonathan<WH3083> told<WH5046> David<WH1732>, saying<WH559>, Saul<WH7586> my father<WH1> seeketh<WH1245> to slay<WH4191> thee<WH8104>: now therefore, I pray thee, take heed to thyself in the morning<WH1242>, and abide<WH3427> in a secret<WH5643> place<WH2244>, and hide thyself:

and I will go out<WH3318> and stand<WH5975> beside<WH3027> my father<WH1> in the field<WH7704> where thou art<WH1696>, and I will commune with my father<WH1> of thee<WH4100>; and if I see<WH7200> aught<WH5046>, I will tell thee.

And Jonathan<WH3083> spake<WH1696> good<WH2896> of David<WH1732> unto Saul<WH7586> his father<WH1>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH4428>, Let not the king sin<WH2398> against his servant<WH5650>, against David<WH1732>; because he hath not sinned<WH2398> against thee<WH4639>, and because his works have been to thee-ward<WH3966> very good<WH2896>:

for he put<WH7760> his life<WH5315> in his hand<WH3709>, and smote<WH5221> the Philistine<WH6430>, and Jehovah<WH3068> wrought<WH6213> a great<WH1419> victory<WH8668> for all Israel<WH3478>: thou sawest<WH7200> it<WH8055>, and didst rejoice; wherefore then wilt thou sin<WH2398> against innocent<WH5355> blood<WH1818>, to slay<WH4191> David<WH1732> without a cause<WH2600>?
And Saul<WH7586> hearkened<WH8085> unto the voice<WH6963> of Jonathan<WH3083>: and Saul<WH7586> sware<WH7650>, As Jehovah<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, he shall not<WH518> be put to death<WH4191>.

And Jonathan<WH3083> called<WH7121> David<WH1732>, and Jonathan<WH3083> showed<WH5046> him all those things<WH1697>. And Jonathan<WH3083> brought<WH935> David<WH1732> to Saul<WH7586>, and he was in his presence<WH6440>, as beforetime<WH865>.

And there was war<WH4421> again<WH3254>: and David<WH1732> went out<WH3318>, and fought<WH3898> with the Philistines<WH6430>, and slew<WH5221> them with a great<WH1419> slaughter<WH4347>; and they fled<WH5127> before him<WH6440>.

And an evil<WH7451> spirit<WH7307> from Jehovah<WH3068> was upon Saul<WH7586>, as he sat<WH3427> in his house<WH1004> with his spear<WH2595> in his hand<WH3027>; and David<WH1732> was playing<WH5059> with his hand<WH3027>.

And Saul<WH7586> sought<WH1245> to smite<WH5221> David<WH1732> even to the wall<WH7023> with the spear<WH2595>; but he slipped away<WH6362> out of Saul<WH7586>'s presence<WH6440>, and he smote<WH5221> the spear<WH2595> into the wall<WH7023>: and David<WH1732> fled<WH5127>, and escaped<WH4422> that night<WH3915>.

And Saul<WH7586> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto David<WH1732>'s house<WH1004>, to watch<WH8104> him<WH4191>, and to slay him in the morning<WH1242>: and Michal<WH4324>, David<WH1732>'s wife<WH802>, told<WH5046> him<WH559>, saying, If thou save<WH4422> not thy life<WH5315> to-night<WH3915>, to-morrow<WH4279> thou wilt be slain<WH4191>.
So Michal<WH4324> let<WH3381> David<WH1732> down<WH3381> through the window<WH2474>: and he went<WH3212>, and fled<WH1272>, and escaped<WH4422>.

And Michal<WH4324> took<WH3947> the teraphim<WH8655>, and laid<WH7760> it in the bed<WH4296>, and put<WH7760> a pillow<WH3523> of goats<WH5795>' hair at the head<WH4763> thereof<WH3680>, and covered it with the clothes<WH899>.
And when Saul<WH7586> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to take<WH3947> David<WH1732>, she said<WH559>, He is sick<WH2470>.
And Saul<WH7586> sent<WH7971> the messengers<WH4397> to see<WH7200> David<WH1732>, saying<WH559>, Bring him up<WH5927> to me in the bed<WH4296>, that I may slay him<WH4191>.
And when the messengers<WH4397> came in<WH935>, behold<WH8655>, the teraphim was in<WH935> the bed<WH4296>, with the pillow<WH3523> of goats<WH5795>' hair at the head thereof.

And Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> unto Michal<WH4324>, Why hast thou deceived me thus<WH7411>, and let mine enemy<WH341> go<WH7411>, so that he is escaped<WH4422>? And Michal<WH4324> answered<WH559> Saul<WH7586>, He said<WH559> unto me<WH7971>, Let me go; why should I kill thee<WH4191>?

Now David<WH1732> fled<WH1272>, and escaped<WH4422>, and came<WH935> to Samuel<WH8050> to Ramah<WH7414>, and told<WH5046> him all that Saul<WH7586> had done<WH6213> to him<WH8050>. And he and Samuel went<WH3212> and dwelt<WH3427> in Naioth<WH5121>.
And it was told<WH5046> Saul<WH7586>, saying<WH559>, Behold<WH1732>, David is at Naioth<WH5121> in Ramah<WH7414>.

And Saul<WH7586> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to take<WH3947> David<WH1732>: and when they saw<WH7200> the company<WH3862> of the prophets<WH5030> prophesying<WH5012>, and Samuel<WH8050> standing<WH5975> as head<WH5324> over them<WH7307>, the Spirit of God<WH430> came upon the messengers<WH4397> of Saul<WH7586>, and they also prophesied<WH5012>.

And when it was told<WH5046> Saul<WH7586>, he sent<WH7971> other<WH312> messengers<WH4397>, and they also prophesied<WH5012>. And Saul<WH7586> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> again<WH3254> the third<WH7992> time<WH5012>, and they also prophesied.

Then went<WH3212> he also to Ramah<WH7414>, and came<WH935> to the great<WH1419> well<WH953> that is in Secu<WH7906>: and he asked<WH7592> and said<WH559>, Where<WH375> are Samuel<WH8050> and David<WH1732>? And one said<WH559>, Behold<WH5121>, they are at Naioth in Ramah<WH7414>.

And he went<WH3212> thither to Naioth<WH5121> in Ramah<WH7414>: and the Spirit<WH7307> of God<WH430> came upon him also<WH3212>, and he went on<WH1980>, and prophesied<WH5012>, until he came<WH935> to Naioth<WH5121> in Ramah<WH7414>.

And he also<WH1571> stripped off<WH6584> his clothes<WH899>, and he also prophesied<WH5012> before<WH6440> Samuel<WH8050>, and lay down<WH5307> naked<WH6174> all that day<WH3117> and all that night<WH3915>. Wherefore they say<WH559>, Is Saul<WH7586> also among the prophets<WH5030>?
